image.altText: Three generations of women sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: For Canberra woman Belle Hogg, the first sign her life was about to change came when her mother forgot her birthday. Suddenly she found herself juggling full-time work, a photography business, raising her three children and caring for her mother.

title.children: Belle's aging mum forgot her birthday. It was the first sign of change

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble building with a sign reading "Law Court of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: A disability worker tells the ACT Supreme Court a quadriplegic man she cares for was "devastated" and cried when he realised his bank account was empty after an alleged fraud committed by his friend.

title.children: Man on trial for allegedly stealing from quadriplegic friend

image.altText: ACT Treasurer Chris Steel

props.synopsis: Canberra residential ratepayers will now pay a $100 health levy, down from the $250 announced in last week's budget, after the ACT government was forced to negotiate with the Greens.

title.children: ACT health levy slashed to $100 as part of budget deal with Greens

image.altText: A child in a sports jersey punches a punching bag.

props.synopsis: First Nations man and founder of Cuz Boxing Joe Hedger spends his days helping young people at risk. As Canberra raises the age of criminal responsibility to 14, services like his will be at the forefront of change.

title.children: 'They don't belong in jail': Age of criminal responsibility now 14 in ACT

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: An ACT Supreme Court jury finds Shegu Bobb, 27, guilty of sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl he met on the dating app Badoo.

title.children: Canberra man found guilty of sexually assaulting 11yo he met on dating app

image.altText: A man holding a caracal

props.synopsis: Under the cover of darkness, and with artillery fire just kilometres away, Marcus Fillinger rescued an emaciated wolf that had been abandoned for weeks in a private zoo in Ukraine.

title.children: Why this Canberran drove a sedated wolf through war-torn Ukraine

props.synopsis: As the world waits to see if Donald Trump's talks will go ahead, look back at how previous US presidents have handled Iran.

title.children: The US helped start Iran's nuclear program — but now wants to end it

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is changing its Working with Children Check laws after ABC reporting revealed they are the weakest in the country.

title.children: Victoria to strengthen Working with Children Check system, years after change recommended

image.altText: Zohran Mamdani

props.synopsis: "There's a real assembly line for incoming politicians that has changed the nature of the kinds of people that get elected," a political academic tells the ABC.

title.children: Mamdani broke through American's political establishment. That's harder to do in Australia

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Critics have accused South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas of "shafting" Adelaide City Council after the government legislated to take over the city's urban golf course

title.children: 'Keeps the plebs happy': SA premier at centre of golf controversy

image.altText: A court room hearing for the Yoorrook Justice Commission

props.synopsis: One hundred recommendations are handed down as Australia's first truth-telling inquiry finds crimes against humanity and genocide were committed against Aboriginal people in Victoria.

title.children: Truth-telling inquiry recommends redress for Aboriginal Victorians

image.altText: A false-colour map showing a wind forecast, with strong winds directed towards the NSW coast.

props.synopsis: The effect of the NSW "bomb cyclone" is being felt in parts of the Sunshine State.

title.children: Destructive winds felt in Queensland as result of NSW 'bomb cyclone'

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie poses with a Russian passport in front of a Russian crest.

props.synopsis: A Russian-backed organisation that has bankrolled the legal defence of alleged spies and criminals has been sanctioned by the federal government just weeks after an investigation detailed its support for Australia's most prominent pro-Putin propagandist.

title.children: Russia-backed fund that bankrolled 'Aussie Cossack' sanctioned by Australia

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cheshire Police says the investigation into corporate manslaughter offences does not have any impact on Lucy Letby's 2023 convictions for murder and attempted murder.

title.children: Police arrest hospital bosses where killer nurse Lucy Letby worked

image.altText: A woman walking past a house on fire at night.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin also speaks with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron for the first time since 2022.

title.children: Russia denies US claims it is trying to 'stall' Ukraine peace negotiations

image.altText: Man looking away from camera wears green beanie with 'Devils' written on it

props.synopsis: Whether or not to spend many millions of dollars on a stadium in Hobart is a question being weighed by voters, with some saying they'll change who they usually vote for.

title.children: Some Tasmanians are changing the party they'll support 'for the first time ever'

image.altText: A street with cars and buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Morwell has played host to Erin Patterson's murder trial for the past nine weeks. Here's what it's been like in the regional Victorian town.

title.children: When the world is watching one town and its courtroom, what happens?

image.altText: Dishwasher stacked with dishes after being rinsed first

props.synopsis: New research has found cleaning plastic containers in the dishwasher is actually a source of microplastic pollution.

title.children: Average dishwasher releases 33 million microplastic particles per year, research finds

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: The president also suggested DOGE would look at Elon Musk's US government subsidies, indicating a widening fight between the president and his former supporter.

title.children: Trump suggests White House will 'take a look' at deporting Elon Musk

image.altText: Paetongtarn Shinawatra stands with her hand in a wai with a microphone flanked by a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court suspends Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from duty pending a case seeking her dismissal.

title.children: Thai PM suspended after leaked phone call

image.altText: india factor explosion 1

props.synopsis: At least 36 people have been killed and about three dozen injured in a massive explosion and fire at a pharmaceutical factory in India.

title.children: Indian factory explosion kills at least 36 people

image.altText: A dry paddock through a wire fence.

props.synopsis: Parts of south-west and western Victoria have been experiencing their lowest rainfall since 1900 and climatologists say recent downpours won't be enough to end the drought.

title.children: What will it take to break the drought in Victoria?

image.altText: A riverbank, as seen from a distance, with a crocodile basking on it.

props.synopsis: Authorities spent a week trying to capture the animal after it was seen in the Maryborough area, about 200 kilometres away from its usual habitat.

title.children: Crocodile euthanased after being spotted in atypical habitat

image.altText: Five girls stand close to each other on a sunny porch

props.synopsis: The new development means Brian Kohberger will not go to trial as planned in August, and will face four life sentences. Here's what we know.

title.children: Accused Idaho college killer to plead guilty to murders

image.altText: A dingo eats from a jar of peanut butter while lying in some long grass.

props.synopsis: Rangers on the World Heritage-listed island off Queensland's coast urge visitors to secure their food, bait and rubbish from dingoes.

title.children: Belongings destroyed as K'gari rangers warn of four-legged thieves

image.altText: A black and white photo of a group of people with their faces blacked out

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department has cracked down on an alleged North Korean scheme to use remote tech workers to fund its weapons programs.

title.children: FBI says it dismantled North Korean fraud scheme spanning 16 US states

image.altText: A young, bearded man with ginger hair smiles while standing on a country property.

props.synopsis: Adam Sutton had just collected his six-year-old son from his first day of school when they were involved in collision with Peter Agius, 23, in Gippsland in 2023.

title.children: Driver who killed young dad denies Snapchat distraction, court hears

image.altText: Stacked cartons of beer and bottles of wine line the shelves of a country bottle shop.

props.synopsis: The WA government has doubled down on plans to set the state's liquor laws in stone despite an independent review returning mixed results regarding harm reduction.

title.children: Lukewarm review released amid push to make WA liquor laws permanent

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and black jacket standing next to a wall.

props.synopsis: There have been more than 2,000 fatal overdoses in Australia for the 10th year in a row, according to a new analysis by the Penington Institute.

title.children: The 'huge' Aussie death toll that gets 'very little attention'

image.altText: Two men in white windbreakers hold microphones and smile. One wears a keffiyeh around his neck.

props.synopsis: With more than 200,000 people taking in over 3,000 performances, Glastonbury always offers plenty to talk about. This year was all about protest, secret sets and... Doctor Who

title.children: Amyl and the Sniffers defend Kneecap, Bob Vylan Glastonbury protests

image.altText: Khalid al-Ghannam puts his arms out and shouts to celebrate winning a Club World Cup game.

props.synopsis: Manchester City is shocked by two extra-time goals by Al-Hilal, knocking them out of the Club World Cup in the round of 16.

title.children: Manchester City knocked out of Club World Cup in extra-time boilover

image.altText: Dom Sheed kicks a ball in the 2018 AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Dom Sheed retires after 165 games and one of the most memorable moments in AFL history, and despite becoming the defining kick of his career, that 2018 grand final goal almost never happened.

title.children: Dom Sheed delivered one of the AFL's greatest moments. It nearly never happened

image.altText: Senator Paul Scarr holds 30 year old parliamentary recommendations as he speaks on whistleblowers

props.synopsis: After the Department of Home Affairs conceded it had not been able to use laws that would see former immigration detainees placed back in detention, the Coalition has called for those laws to be amended.

title.children: Coalition demands rewrite of laws to re-detain NZYQ members

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, two First Nations families are on parallel tracks, seeking justice for their teenage sons taken from them before their time. The boys should have been safe and protected — but weren't.

title.children: As two mothers mourn their sons, the silence of legislators speaks volumes

image.altText: A black-and-white image of a smiling, dark-haired man reacting as a soft toy is pushed towards his face.

props.synopsis: The film and television actor is being remembered for his versatility, humbleness and generosity after his death on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Actor and original Play School presenter Donald MacDonald dead at 86
